Bachelor’s degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent professional or military experience  Experience with ML fields, e.g., natural language processing, computer vision, statistical learning theory  4+ years of industry experience in predictive modeling, data science, and analysis  Experience in an ML engineer or data scientist role building and deploying ML models or hands on experience developing deep learning models  Experience writing code in Python, R, Scala, , with documentation for reproducibility  Experience handling terabyte size datasets, diving into data to discover hidden patterns, using data visualization tools, writing SQL, and working with GPUs to develop models  Experience writing and speaking about technical concepts to business, technical, and lay audiences and giving data-driven presentations  Want to help the largest global enterprises derive business value through the adoption of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML)? Excited by using massive amounts of disparate data to develop ML models? Eager to learn to apply ML to a diverse array of enterprise use cases? Thrilled to be a part of Amazon who has been pioneering and shaping the world’s AI/ML technology for decades? At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we are helping large enterprises build ML models on the AWS Cloud. We are applying predictive technology to large volumes of data and against a wide spectrum of problems. AWS Professional Services works together with AWS customers to address their business needs using AI solutions. AWS Professional Services is a unique consulting team. We pride ourselves on being customer obsessed and highly focused on the AI enablement of our customers. If you have experience with AI, including building ML models, we’d like to have you join our team. You will get to work with an innovative company, with great teammates, and have a lot of fun helping our customers. A successful candidate will be a person who enjoys diving deep into data, doing analysis, discovering root causes, and designing long-term solutions. This is a customer-facing role and you will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services as needed.  Major responsibilities include:   Assist customers by being able to deliver a ML project from beginning to end, including understanding the business need, aggregating data, exploring data, building & validating predictive models, and deploying completed models with concept-drift monitoring and retraining to deliver business impact to the organization  Use AWS AI services (e.g., Personalize), ML platforms (SageMaker), and frameworks (e.g., MXNet, TensorFlow, PyTorch, SparkML, scikit-learn) to help our customers build ML models  Research and implement novel ML approaches, including hardware optimizations on platforms such as AWS Inferentia  Work with our other Professional Services consultants (Big Data, IoT, HPC) to analyze, extract, normalize, and label relevant data, and with our Professional Services engineers to operationalize customers’ models after they are prototyped  Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. Work/Life Balance Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer-facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed. Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. About the Role As an applied scientist, you will help develop algorithms for the analysis and enhancement of cognitive processing by formulating solutions based on scientific background, literature review, and data driven insights. The role requires strong communication. You will be closely working with machine learning engineers, software engineers and firmware engineers to efficiently run the developed algorithms on Earable’s neuro-wearables. Position: Data Scientist  Job Description: The Analytics team, supporting our VP of ecommerce at Arrow Electronics, uses data-driven insight to fuel strategic growth and efficiencies for our digital endeavors across the world. We apply a bespoke arsenal of statistical, analytical and computing techniques to complex data problems at scale, with an emphasis on measurable business impact. We work in close collaboration with colleagues across all business functions and disciplines to develop effective, data-powered solutions for key business questions. To help with this, we’re looking for an entry-level Data analyst – an intellectually curious and creative problem solver who is willing to tackle the familiar and unfamiliar of all things data, including methods, technologies and applications. What you will be doing: Our team delivers analytic solutions across a wide variety of applications. We build inferential and predictive models, including machine learning algorithms and AI; we process, integrate and manipulate big data; we synthesize results and translate findings into actionable strategy. As an individual contributor within our team ,  you’ll help solve complex business challenges—from cross-channel media attribution and customer experience optimization to business strategy direction as it relates to sources of growth for our P&L—by accessing, integrating, manipulating, mining and modeling a wide array of data sources. Day-to-day, your role includes: Translating and reframing business questions into analytical plans. Ingesting, accessing and integrating disparate big data sources. Conducting extensive exploratory analysis to identify relevant insights, useful transformations and analytical applications. Applying quantitative techniques, including statistical and machine learning, to uncover latent patterns in the data. Building and testing scalable data pipelines or models for real-time applications. Summarizing, visualizing, communicating and documenting analytic concepts, processes and results for technical and non-technical audiences. Collaborating with internal stakeholders to establish clear analytical objectives, approaches and timelines. Sharing knowledge, debating techniques, and conducting research to advance the collective knowledge and skills of our Analytics team. What we're looking for: A passion for data science and continued learning Hands-on experience mining data for decision-focused insights. Strong communication and data presentation skills, experience analyzing data and communicating results and crafting actionable insights. Experience with data visualization (Power BI is preferred). Hands-on experience working with SQL and relational data. Educational experience with one or more of the following: Python, R, and distributed computing systems such as Hadoop or AWS. Demonstrated self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment with flat structure. Preferred: Familiar with common statistical or machine learning procedures, such as descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, dimension reduction, feature transformation, supervised or unsupervised learning. Experience / Education: Any prior experience in this field is a plus (i.e.: internships) A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, mathematics, econometrics, operations research, data science, computer science, engineering, marketing or social science methods. What’s In It For You At Arrow, we recognize that financial rewards and great benefits are important aspects of an ideal job. That’s why we offer competitive financial compensation, including various compensation plans, and a solid benefits package (http://benefits.arrow.com) Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance 401k, With Matching Contributions Paid Time Off Health Savings Account (HSA)/Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) Options Short-Term/Long-Term Disability Insurance Wide Variety of Growth Opportunities Annual Hiring Range/Hourly Rate: $27.00 - $33.00 Actual compensation offer to candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level. The pay ratio between base pay and target incentive (if applicable) will be finalized at offer. Location: US-CO-Denver, Colorado (Panorama Arrow Building)  Time Type: Full time  Job Category: Information Technology EEO Statement: Arrow is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. (Arrow EEO/AAP policy) Arrow COVID-19 Vaccination Policy: Arrow requires employees to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination by:  December 1, 2021, for all positions located in CO and for business units within immixGroup and Zeus. All other employees will be required to identify vaccination status by December 1, 2021, and provide proof of full vaccination by January 3, 2022.

ChampionX has an immediate need for a  Junior Scientist  located in  Boulder, Colorado  to work on airborne atmospheric measurements from both unmanned drone platforms and manned fixed-wing aircraft. If you are a professional who wants to work in an autonomous, hands-on environment, we invite you to apply. This is your opportunity to join a growing company offering a competitive base salary and benefits. What’s in it For You: The ability to make an impact and shape your career with a company that is dedicated to improving lives and passionate about growth The support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives, and ideas to achieve our best Thrive in a company that values sustainability, drives a safety-focused culture and empowers through continuous improvement Comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with company matching and more! What You Will Do: Aircraft Data Analysis: Unmanned and manned aircraft data analysis Perform data analysis and develop customer reports (using python, Microsoft office, geospatial software and other as appropriate) Perform data analysis and develop customer reports (using python, Microsoft office, geospatial software and other as appropriate) Identify and implement improvements in data procedures and products Present and communicate mission results Effectively communicating with data acquisition staff (drone pilots, flight scientists, manned aircraft pilots, etc.) Backup Airborne Flight Scientist: Occasionally, we have scheduled projects with the manned aircraft and we need a flight scientist. traveling to the field site with the airplane providing in-flight science support throughout the mission taking an active role in flight planning, especially with regard to flight safety, compliance, airspace reviews, and all other operations analyzing and reporting the results Duties and Responsibilities: Data acquisition of atmospheric measurements using a variety of sensors and chemical analyzers to meet project requirements Calibrations and maintenance of technical and scientific instrumentation Ability and willingness to learn the atmospheric measurement instrumentation, methods, and data analysis used by Scientific Aviation Perform moderate-to-advanced level programming in Python Problem-solving: solve real-time problems, both technical and mechanical, and perform limited equipment repairs in the field Represent Scientific Aviation with professionalism and a positive attitude. The Flight Science Technician will often be required to interact with high-profile clients on site Assisting with other duties as needed. Because we are a small company, you will be expected to wear a lot of different hats. While your title might be Scientist, we may need help with social media, organizing the storage closet, writing a proposal, shipping materials for a trade show, etc. Travel: mobility and flexibility is required for this position.  Travel will be 15-40% of the time, to locations throughout North America, potentially abroad, and often includes weekend days. The majority of Scientific Aviation’s drone measurement sites are in oil and gas production fields and are often in relatively rural locations. Minimum Qualifications: Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in a scientific discipline Some familiarity with (or coursework in) basic atmospheric sciences Experience working in a scientific research setting Valid US Passport and Driver’s License Clean driving record Legal right to work in the U.S Must pass a DOT pre-employment drug screen; subject to random drug screen Ability to travel regularly and work a non-standard work schedule Ability to work in a small team environment and take on other tasking as necessary to achieve mission goals Ability to communicate effectively and professionally with clients in the field Preferred Qualifications: Four year college or university degree in Information Technology, Computer Sciences, Software Engineering, or related field. Experience in the oil and gas industry and/or experience and knowledge of ESG, Emissions and/or Atmospheric Sciences Position Details: Role is deemed safety-sensitive and may be subject to employer or customer drug testing. Read, write, and speak English fluently. Competitive attitude and strong work ethic with the ability to enthusiastically represent the company Must be authorized to work in the US; Immigration Sponsorship is not available for this role ChampionX is currently requiring vaccination against Covid-19 for all customer-facing roles where this condition is requested by the customer-facing roles where this condition is requested by the customer and therefore, an essential job requirement. Our world-class safety culture fuels our purpose to improve lives through our commitment to deliver sustainable operations. About Scientific Aviation: ChampionX is helping support a lower-carbon future by providing the technology and expertise to solve emissions monitoring challenges for our customers. Job Details Job Location  Corporate HeadQuarters - Englewood, CO Remote Type  Optional Work from Home Position Type  Full Time Education Level  Graduate Degree Salary Range  $90,000.00 - $150,000.00 Salary/year Job Shift  Day Data Scientist - Algorithm Engineer  Data Scientist-Algorithm Engineer   The Data Scientist/Algorithms Engineer is responsible for working with project teams in defining the need for mathematical/statistical/algorithm development in any given project or process; generating mathematical analyses and algorithms; performing statistical analyses; performing experiments; and documenting research and development efforts.   Join us in developing the next generation of non-invasive patient monitoring devices that will change standards of care, improve patient outcomes, and save lives. If you are looking to join an amazing company that is passionate about making a difference in patient’s lives, then Zynex is the place for you.  Location: Hybrid position, combination of remote, Boulder, CO and/or Englewood, CO   Zynex Offers Exceptional Benefits (Full-Time Roles):  Premium starting pay  Health, dental, & vision insurance  401k with company contribution  8 paid holidays + up to 2 additional floating holidays (1 every 6 months)  3 weeks Paid Time Off (PTO) for sick or vacation time; increases to 4 weeks after 2 years with the company  Annual  LinkedIn Learning  subscription to facilitate employee skill and competency development  Health & wellness bonus up to $50/month  Frequent opportunities for role transitions and advancements  Weekly employee appreciation activities/perks  Up to $75/month reimbursement for community volunteer hours  Employee product discounts   Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:  Confer with customers, marketing, management, engineers, researchers, and scientists to determine the need for, and to define the requirements of, desired mathematical/statistical/algorithm development for new or ongoing projects, processes, or products.  Prepare engineering analyses of mathematical projects which may include: preliminary system design, development of product and/or user requirements, life cycle analysis, testing, and verification and validation (V&V) needs. Develop, design, and integrate mathematical, statistical, and algorithmic processes and/or products for manufacturing, new product or process development, or for modifications to existing products or processes.  Select and utilize mathematical design software to perform engineering tasks.  Develop project plans, budgets, and schedules. Manage project issues, budgets, and schedules to bring projects in on time, within budget, and to assure that the engineering output meets the design requirements and specifications.  Develop, prepare, review, and critique proposed changes to project and engineering documentation including requirements, specifications, drawings, test protocols, test reports, standards, policies, work instructions, and procedures. Design, develop, implement, and document experimental protocols, including benchtop, laboratory, in vitro and in vivo studies. Stay abreast of the mathematical techniques and algorithms, as well as the science, physics, and medicine that apply to the Company’s products.  Perform all job duties in accordance with the Company’s Quality System procedures where applicable.  Alert management to any safety concerns with the performance of any assigned tasks. Utilize the appropriate safety precautions and equipment necessary to perform all tasks. Participate in creating a safe working environment for her or himself and those whom she or he supervises.   Additional Responsibilities Provide technical presentations to elected officials, appointed boards/commissions, the public, and staff. Work requires travel to meetings, site visits, and inspections. Work requires willingness to work a flexible schedule including weekends and evenings as necessary.  Other duties as assigned.   Required Knowledge and Skills:  Work requires high level of attention to detail and advanced background in applied mathematics, specifically linear algebra, harmonic analysis, probability/statistics, and numerical methods  An M.S. or Ph.D. in applied mathematics, statistics, or digital signal processing, and a minimum of two years of design experience in a scientific or engineering environment. A high level of proficiency in scientific programming in either MatLab or Python and proficiency with C/C++ for embedded applications.  Expertise in experimental design, data collection and exploratory data analysis/visualization. Understanding of basic electronics and data acquisition techniques.  Excellent written and oral communication skills and high level of proficiency in the English language.  Fluency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).   Desired Knowledge and Skills:  Extensive knowledge of multivariate statistical analysis including regression analysis and dimensionality reduction techniques.  Familiarity with classical machine learning techniques as well as neural network models.  Background in biostatistics related to statistical design of clinical studies including power analysis and basic statistical inference.  Familiarity with time series analysis and digital filtering.  Experience in the medical device industry or other industry operating under a quality management system.  Experience in biology or chemistry laboratory setting.  Operation of lab equipment including medical analyzers.  Knowledge of basic anatomy and physiology.  Knowledge of the principles of photoplethysmography and its application to pulse oximetry   Note: This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities or qualifications associated with the job.   **Employees are held accountable for all duties of this job**  Zynex Medical, Inc and Zynex Monitoring Solutions are Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employers

job_title: Sr. Data Scientist - Utility Customer Applications
job_Description: Interested in driving data science innovation? * We are growing!* We have multiple open Data Scientist positions. In this position you will be a technical project delivery team leader collaborating on data science projects with disciplined utility experts and E Source data scientists, software engineers, and machine learning engineering experts. Example projects include predicting asset failures, analyzing aerial imagery using computer vision algorithms and geospatial statistics, forecasting power consumption for individual customers and in aggregate within distribution systems, and forecasting consumer adoption of utility-managed programs and services. Our ideal candidates will have significant experience using R or Python (with a preference for fluency in both) in multiple analytical applications, utilizing for example: Generalized linear models Time series approaches Penalized regression models Tree-based ensemble models Neural network models As a technical delivery team leader, your day-to-day tasks may include creative problem-solving activities such as: Translating a scope of work into technical tasks for project team assignments using Jira issues Data exploration and evaluating sufficiency to perform tasks Developing models and validating model performance Developing and maintaining data science pipelines for repeated execution Code repository management and code reviews Communication with clients (internal or external) throughout the data science project lifecycle Identifying data sources which can facilitate data science solutions to utility industry problems You'll be a full-time member of E Source Data Science. Our data science positions appeal to self-starters who welcome and excel in team-based, collaborative projects from conception to end-user handoff, providing an excellent customer experience throughout. The ability to simplify complex analyses into understandable concepts that are applicable to management and operations staff is highly desired. * Benefits* * We offer excellent insurance packages, including medical, dental, and vision plans; company-paid life insurance; company-paid long- and short-term disability insurance; and medical and dependent-care flexible spending plans. We provide a Flexible Time Off (FTO) program, E Source employees have the flexibility to take off as many days off per year as they need, with manager approval, while fulfilling their work obligations and ensuring proper coverage of their work. We offer flexible schedules, additional time-off banks for jury duty, bereavement, and a parental leave benefit. We provide a 401(k) plan with a 3% employer match. The budgeted salary for this position is  $125,000-$145,000 + annual bonus . Actual pay will be adjusted based on experience. This person can work remote, a hybrid schedule or from one of our physical office locations located in Boulder, CO, Baton Rouge, LA, Birmingham, AL, Buffalo, NY or Nashville, TN. Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the US. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment Visa at this time. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. job_Description: COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. Description: Do you have a passion for math, software, and telling a story with data?  Lockheed Martin's is seeking a motivated data analyst to support the Missile Defense National Team (MDNT) in support of developing tools and analysis of missile tracking and models.  Responsibilities will include:  Be a part of a focused technical team verifying and validating metrics, statistics and descriptive analysis of actual and hypothetical test data from Missile Defense Systems in development in support of national security.  Perform research and analysis to identify meaningful metrics, patterns and trends from the test datasets, and use statistical methods to validate or reject hypotheses about the data. Techniques may include visualization, simulation, message-based analysis and system modeling to achieve the desired analysis results.  Collaborating/coordinating with peers across the program to develop solutions to technical problems and provide actionable insights to C2BMC decision makers.  You will be expected to travel as needed (less than 10%).  Majority of work will be conducted at Schriever SFB due to access to test data.  Intermittently some non-standard work hours are possible.  Basic Qualifications: *Must currently hold DoD Secret security clearance to be considered for this position*   Bachelors' degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 5 years of professional experience; or 3 years of professional experience with a related Master's degree Experience in the use of software test and analysis tools for message-based systems Experience with Object oriented software; e.g. Python and/or Java Experience with the Linux environment Security+ certification (can start without but must obtain in 60 days) Should possess technical skills to develop software tools and models to evaluate software, algorithms and processes used to build the Command and Control, Battle Management and Communications (C2BMC) element of the Missile Defense System (MDS) Be able to assist test tool analysts with technical troubleshooting and analysis of test traceability and analysis tools Should understand the math and statistics behind the models and be able to interpret, extrapolate and deliver actionable recommendations. May be required to obtain Top Secret DoD Security Clearance at a later date Desired Skills:  Experience in the use of COTS modeling, simulation and analysis tools C2BMC experience Python programming experience Bash or similar scripting experience Strong sense of how data "tells a story” Experience with using and maintaining relational databases Experience with software test and analysis tools Development and automation of data management processes and tools Experience in designing/testing software from a systems engineering perspective. Strong teamwork skills Excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:  Medical (some LM locations have on-site medical) Dental 401k (with generous matching) Paid time off including, (we have a 4x10 schedule which means: 52 three-day weekends!) Learn more about our competitive and comprehensive benefits package: https://www.lockheedmartinjobs.com/working-here#benefits  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Please contact us to request an accommodation.  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications   Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.  As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. The Raytheon Intelligence and Space (RI&S) Data Science and Technologies (DST) team leads interdisciplinary applied research and development (R&D) for all of RI&S. R&D ranges from concept development, trade studies, and rapid prototyping for customized engineering products and services. We develop solutions to solve customer needs as well as plan future capabilities and technology roadmaps.  Raytheon is looking to fill several data science and Artificial Intelligence (AI) positions in Dulles, VA, Richardson, TX, or Aurora, CO. The candidate will join a small, agile group focused on applying state of the art data science (DS), data engineering (DE), and AI approaches to a variety of customer problems. Modern DS/DE/AI approaches are inherently interdisciplinary, integrating concepts from Computer Science, Physics, Statistics, and Mathematics among other fields. Therefore, the candidate must have both technical depth in data engineering combined with interdisciplinary breadth to integrate concepts from other fields.  Raytheon data scientists combine knowledge of statistical and machine learning practices with practical programming skills to provide data-driven solutions to real world problems. We are looking for data scientists who will be able to work in a team composed of data scientists and data engineers to support a variety of software development teams who are building applications for the modern warfighter and intelligence analyst. The ideal candidate will be able to work with product teams to identify rich data science opportunities, develop data-centric solutions, and deploy those solutions to a secure production environment.  Typical tasks may include: Work with product teams, users, and other stakeholders to identify opportunities for data-driven solutions. Help build sophisticated optimization models and create algorithms for quickly producing cutting-edge solutions according to those models. Use supervised and unsupervised machine learning approaches to develop insights and provide recommendations or predictions for future events. Generate hypotheses, design experiments, gather, review and transform data, and test the hypotheses using modern and statistically rigorous methodologies. Develop new techniques and applications in optimization, statistics, and machine learning fields and present those findings to internal leadership teams, external DoD/IC customers, and/or academic communities. Requirements: Requires 8 years of relevant engineering experience Theoretical and practical background in one or more of statistical analysis, machine learning, sensor phenomenology, predictive modeling, and/or optimization. Experience in languages commonly used for data analysis such as Python. Candidates must have a strong coding background. Experience working with large-scale data sets. Experience producing data visualizations for a variety of audiences. Excellent verbal and written communications skills along with the ability to present technical data and approaches to both technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to start with a messy unstructured problem, identify specific research questions from it, and propose data and model-driven solutions that would create value for end-users and other stakeholders. Knowledge of current developments and trends in statistics, machine learning, and big data.
